meanings.definition: To surpass in writing or literary skill.
meanings.sent1: She managed to outwrit her classmates in the school writing competition.
meanings.sent2: The famous author always strives to outwrit his previous works.
meanings.sent3: In the writing contest, she decided to outwrit her own expectations.
meanings.sent4: His eloquent words outwrit the silence that filled the room.
meanings.sent5: The poet's verses outwrit the beauty of the sunset.

meanings.definition: To outdo in writing or composition.
meanings.sent1: The young writer aimed to outwrit her favorite author's style.
meanings.sent2: He hoped to outwrit his previous essay with his latest piece.
meanings.sent3: The competition was fierce, but she was determined to outwrit them all.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity outwrit any boundaries that tried to confine her.
meanings.sent5: The playwright's script outwrit the audience's expectations.
